column5: Well took the young lad out for a couple hours today,didn't get any eyes but we hit the perch pretty good,he even caught a 1.2 lber.Had fun though till the wind and bein out of minnows forced us off.
Nice perch. Better buy more minnow next time though. Thanks for the pictures and report.
Just to let everyone know there was 10 inches or better where we were,by point Anne.Cheers  Bassman
Good stuff, you're a brave pair being out there today...thanks for sharing  Maureen
Nice job guys!  With the cold and wind, you sure are hardcore!  I'm sure you'll get into some nice eyes the next time you are out. Thanks for the report!
Thanks fer sharin' Pointe Anne, is that on the Bay of Quinte?

yup, at BOQ. i was there on sunday, plenty of ice i was driving on it, saw atleast 4  others out there further then me. but becareful, the shoreline was cracking a bit when i was there. the ice was for sure over 12 inches. i stuck my head in the hole and i wasnt even done drilling yet... lol

but clampet if you plan on heading that way, you better be getting up at 3 or 4 to head out, will be a 2-3 hr drive and you want to get there before sunrise for them walleyes, i got there at 9, nadda. however when i got there, i saw a few fellows with some very nice sized eyes there.
